Text: RE New Production Web ServerPST Shoot I guess that print config page is not as convienient as advertised We are getting two of these Compaq ProLiant DL Dual Pentium III Ghz GB SDRAM MHz x RAID setting GB hot pluggable Ultra SCSI rpm Hard Drives So that is the basic scoop Being that we will only use this for final draft web stuff I dont forsee ever hitting that GB disk space limit The coolest part is that this is a times better system but two of these will cost less than we spent on the current system almost a year ago Original Message From Richey Cooper Sent Monday May AM To Anderson Robert Subject Re New Production Web Server Bob sounds good but the page you sent me doesnt work maybe i need a cookie or its only temporary what are the basic specs c From Robert nronXgate on AM CDT To Cooper CT cc Subject New Production Web Server Cooper I thought that you might be interested in an update to our web server activities Our plan at this point is to purchase a new production server and keep the existing system as the development server and file server This is what we are looking at printconfigaspoiECEDdcpqsidDMLAVWFSGNAKHBTVUAHFBEID We are planning to purchase two of these identical of course We plan to have one mirror the other so the we can balance the load and also so that in the event of a problem one can function independent of the other the idea the we can literally shut one down without the web site going down is exciting also being able to upgrade by simply slapping in a new pizza box is quite intriguing Any comments that you might have are more than welcome Bob
Thermal OutagesIf this is not exactly what you wanted just let me know Bob
